item.title: Mentioned by iPolitics.ca (subscription)
item.description:
Canada's youngest MP on Quebec separatism: “it's finished”
... according to the youngest ever member of Parliament. “I think it's finished,” said NDP MP Pierre-Luc Dusseault. The Sherbrooke MP insists that his constituents care more about environmental protection and economic stability than Quebec independence.

item.description:

iPolitics fronts NDP MP Pierre-Luc Dusseault, the youngest member of the House of Commons, saying he thinks separatism is finished in Quebec. CBC.ca leads with a looming Supreme Court decision about the ability of authorities to obtain private text ...

item.title: Mentioned by Montreal Gazette
item.description:
Quebec New Democrat Claude Patry defects to Bloc over Clarity Act debate
Jonquiere-Alma MP Claude Patry announced he was crossing the floor to the Bloc Quebecois because he wasn't comfortable with legislation his party recently put forward to amend the Clarity Act, former prime minister Jean Chretien's attempt to rewrite the rules surrounding a province's separation from ... Pierre-Luc Dusseault, another Quebec New Democrat who has come under fire for comments he's made in the past about sovereignty, said his party's Quebec caucus has met to discuss the NDP's unity bill.
